g4701.definition: [σπορά] from {{g4687}}; a sowing, i.e. (by implication) parentage

g4702.definition: [σπόριμος] from {{g4703}}; sown, i.e. (neuter plural) a planted field

g4703.definition: [σπόρος] from {{g4687}}; a scattering (of seed), i.e. (concretely) seed (as sown)

g4704.definition: [σπουδάζω] from {{g4710}}; to use speed, i.e. to make effort, be prompt or earnest

g4706.definition: [σπουδαιότερον] neuter of {{g4707}} as adverb; more earnestly than others), i.e. very promptly

g4707.definition: [σπουδαιότερος] comparative of {{g4705}}; more prompt, more earnest

g4708.definition: [σπουδαιοτέρως] adverb from {{g4707}}; more speedily, i.e. sooner than otherwise

g4710.definition: [σπουδή] from {{g4692}}; "speed", i.e. (by implication) despatch, eagerness, earnestness

g4711.definition: [σπυρίς] from {{g4687}} (as woven); a hamper or lunch-receptacle

g4712.definition: [στάδιον] , or masculine (in plural)      στάδιοςfrom the base of {{g2476}} (as fixed); a stade or certain measure of distance; by implication, a stadium or race-course

g4713.definition: [στάμνος] from the base of {{g2476}} (as stationary); a jar or earthen tank

g4714.definition: [στάσις] from the base of {{g2476}}; a standing (properly, the act), i.e. (by analogy) position (existence); by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy

g4715.definition: [στατήρ] from the base of {{g2746}}; a stander (standard of value), i.e. (specially), a stater or certain coin

g4716.definition: [σταυρός] from the base of {{g2476}}; a stake or post (as set upright), i.e. (specially), a pole or cross (as an instrument of capital punishment); figuratively, exposure to death, i.e. self-denial; by implication, the atonement of Christ

g4717.definition: [σταυρόω] from {{g4716}}; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish (subdue) passion or selfishness

g4718.definition: [σταφυλή] probably from the base of {{g4735}}; a cluster of grapes (as if intertwined)

g4719.definition: [στάχυς] from the base of {{g2476}}; a head of grain (as standing out from the stalk)

g4720.definition: [Στάχυς] the same as {{g4719}}; Stachys, a Christian

g4721.definition: [στέγη] strengthened from a primary τέγος (a "thatch" or "deck" of a building); a roof

g4722.definition: [στέγω] from {{g4721}}; to roof over, i.e. (figuratively) to cover with silence (endure patiently)

g4723.definition: [στείρος] a contraction from {{g4731}} (as stiff and unnatural); "sterile"

g4724.definition: [στέλλω] probably strengthened from the base of {{g2476}}; properly, to set fast ("stall"), i.e. (figuratively) to repress (reflexively, abstain from associating with)

g4725.definition: [στέμμα] from the base of {{g4735}}; a wreath for show

g4727.definition: [στενάζω] from {{g4728}}; to make (intransitively, be) in straits, i.e. (by implication) to sigh, murmur, pray inaudibly

g4728.definition: [στενός] probably from the base of {{g2476}}; narrow (from obstacles standing close about)

g4729.definition: [στενοχωρέω] from the same as {{g4730}}; to hem in closely, i.e. (figuratively) cramp

g4730.definition: [στενοχωρία] from a compound of {{g4728}} and {{g5561}}; narrowness of room, i.e. (figuratively) calamity

g4731.definition: [στερεός] from {{g2476}}; stiff, i.e. solid, stable (literally or figuratively)

g4732.definition: [στερεόω] from {{g4731}}; to solidify, i.e. confirm (literally or figuratively)

g4734.definition: [Στεφανᾶς] probably contraction for στεφανωτός (crowned; from {{g4737}}); Stephanas, a Christian

g4735.definition: [στέφανος] from an apparently primary στέφω (to twine or wreathe); a chaplet (as a badge of royalty, a prize in the public games or a symbol of honor generally; but more conspicuous and elaborate than the simple fillet, {{g1238}}), literally or figuratively

g4736.definition: [Στέφανος] the same as {{g4735}}; Stephanus, a Christian

g4737.definition: [στεφανόω] from {{g4735}}; to adorn with an honorary wreath (literally or figuratively)

g4738.definition: [στῆθος] from {{g2476}} (as standing prominently); the (entire external) bosom, i.e. chest

g4739.definition: [στήκω] from the perfect tense of {{g2476}}; to be stationary, i.e. (figuratively) to persevere

g4741.definition: [στηρίζω] from a presumed derivative of {{g2476}} (like {{g4731}}); to set fast, i.e. (literally) to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or (figuratively) to confirm

g4742.definition: [στίγμα] from a primary στίζω (to "stick", i.e. prick); a mark incised or punched (for recognition of ownership), i.e. (figuratively) scar of service

g4743.definition: [στιγμή] feminine of {{g4742}}; a point of time, i.e. an instant

g4744.definition: [στίλβω] apparently a primary verb; to gleam, i.e. flash intensely

g4745.definition: [στοά] probably from {{g2476}}; a colonnade or interior piazza

g4746.definition: [στοιβάς] from a primary στείβω (to "step" or "stamp"); a spread (as if tramped flat) of loose materials for a couch, i.e. (by implication) a bough of a tree so employed

g4747.definition: [στοιχεῖον] neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of {{g4748}}; something orderly in arrangement, i.e. (by implication) a serial (basal, fundamental, initial) constituent (literally), proposition (figuratively)

g4748.definition: [στοιχέω] from a derivative of στείχω (to range in regular line); to march in (military) rank (keep step), i.e. (figuratively) to conform to virtue and piety

g4749.definition: [στολή] from {{g4724}}; equipment, i.e. (specially), a "stole" or long-fitting gown (as a mark of dignity)

g4750.definition: [στόμα] probably strengthened from a presumed derivative of the base of {{g5114}}; the mouth (as if a gash in the face); by implication, language (and its relations); figuratively, an opening (in the earth); specially, the front or edge (of a weapon)

g4751.definition: [στόμαχος] from {{g4750}}; an orifice (the gullet), i.e. (specially), the "stomach"

g4752.definition: [στρατεία] from {{g4754}}; military service, i.e. (figuratively) the apostolic career (as one of hardship and danger)

g4753.definition: [στράτευμα] from {{g4754}}; an armament, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops (more or less extensive or systematic)

g4754.definition: [στρατεύομαι] middle voice from the base of {{g4756}}; to serve in a military campaign; figuratively, to execute the apostolate (with its arduous duties and functions), to contend with carnal inclinations

g4755.definition: [στρατηγός] from the base of {{g4756}} and {{g71}} or {{g2233}}; a general, i.e. (by implication or analogy) a (military) governor (prætor), the chief (præfect) of the (Levitical) temple-wardens

g4756.definition: [στρατιά] feminine of a derivative of στρατός (an army; from the base of {{g4766}}, as encamped); camp-likeness, i.e. an army, i.e. (figuratively) the angels, the celestial luminaries

g4757.definition: [στρατιώτης] from a presumed derivative of the same as {{g4756}}; a camper-out, i.e. a (common) warrior (literally or figuratively)

g4758.definition: [στρατολογέω] from a compound of the base of {{g4756}} and {{g3004}} (in its original sense); to gather (or select) as a warrior, i.e. enlist in the army

g4759.definition: [στρατοπεδάρχης] from {{g4760}} and {{g757}}; a ruler of an army, i.e. (specially), a Prætorian præfect

g4760.definition: [στρατόπεδον] from the base of {{g4756}} and the same as {{g3977}}; a camping-ground, i.e. (by implication) a body of troops

g4761.definition: [στρεβλόω] from a derivative of {{g4762}}; to wrench, i.e. (specially), to torture (by the rack), but only figuratively, to pervert

g4762.definition: [στρέφω] strengthened from the base of {{g5157}}; to twist, i.e. turn quite around or reverse (literally or figuratively)

g4763.definition: [στρηνιάω] from a presumed derivative of {{g4764}}; to be luxurious

g4764.definition: [στρῆνος] akin to {{g4731}}; a "straining", "strenuousness" or "strength", i.e. (figuratively) luxury (voluptuousness)

g4765.definition: [στρουθίον] diminutive of στρουθός (a sparrow); a little sparrow

g4766.definition: [στρώννυμι] ,  or simpler      στρωννύω; prolongation from a still simpler      στρόω, (used only as an alternate in certain tenses) (probably akin to {{g4731}} through the idea of positing); to "strew," i.e. spread (as a carpet or couch)

g4767.definition: [στυγνητός] from a derivative of an obsolete apparently primary στύγω (to hate); hated, i.e. odious

g4768.definition: [στυγνάζω] from the same as {{g4767}}; to render gloomy, i.e. (by implication) glower (be overcast with clouds, or sombreness of speech)

g4769.definition: [στῦλος] from στύω (to stiffen; properly akin to the base of {{g2476}}); a post ("style"), i.e. (figuratively) support

g4770.definition: [Στωϊκός] from {{g4745}}; a "Stoic" (as occupying a particular porch in Athens), i.e. adherent of a certin philosophy

g4771.definition: [σύ] the personal pronoun of the second person singular; thou See also {{g4571}}, {{g4671}}, {{g4675}}; and for the plural {{g5209}}, {{g5210}}, {{g5213}}, {{g5216}}.

g4773.definition: [συγγενής] from {{g4862}} and {{g1085}}; a relative (by blood); by extension, a fellow countryman

g4774.definition: [συγγνώμη] from a compound of {{g4862}} and {{g1097}}; fellow knowledge, i.e. concession

g4775.definition: [συγκάθημαι] from {{g4862}} and {{g2521}}; to seat oneself in company with

g4776.definition: [συγκαθίζω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2523}}; to give (or take) a seat in company with

g4777.definition: [συγκακοπαθέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2553}}; to suffer hardship in company with

g4778.definition: [συγκακουχέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2558}}; to maltreat in company with, i.e. (passively) endure persecution together

g4781.definition: [συγκάμπτω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2578}}; to bend together, i.e. (figuratively) to afflict

g4782.definition: [συγκαταβαίνω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2597}}; to descend in company with

g4783.definition: [συγκατάθεσις] from {{g4784}}; a deposition (of sentiment) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) accord with

g4784.definition: [συγκατατίθεμαι] middle from {{g4862}} and {{g2698}}; to deposit (one's vote or opinion) in company with, i.e. (figuratively) to accord with

g4785.definition: [συγκαταψηφίζω] from {{g4862}} and a compound of {{g2596}} and {{g5585}}; to count down in company with, i.e. enroll among

g4786.definition: [συγκεράννυμι] from {{g4862}} and {{g2767}}; to commingle, i.e. (figuratively) to combine or assimilate

g4787.definition: [συγκινέω] from {{g4682}} and {{g2795}}; to move together, i.e. (specially), to excite as a mass (to sedition)

g4788.definition: [συγκλείω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2808}}; to shut together, i.e. include or (figuratively) embrace in a common subjection to

g4789.definition: [συγκληρονόμος] from {{g4862}} and {{g2818}}; a co-heir, i.e. (by analogy) participant in common

g4790.definition: [συγκοινωνέω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2841}}; to share in company with, i.e. co-participate in

g4792.definition: [συγκομίζω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2865}}; to convey together, i.e. collect or bear away in company with others

g4793.definition: [συγκρίνω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2919}}; to judge of one thing in connection with another, i.e. combine (spiritual ideas with appropriate expressions) or collate (one person with another by way of contrast or resemblance)

g4794.definition: [συγκύπτω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2955}}; to stoop altogether, i.e. be completely overcome by

g4795.definition: [συγκυρία] from a comparative of {{g4862}} and κυρέω (to light or happen; from the base of {{g2962}}); concurrence, i.e. accident

g4796.definition: [συγχαίρω] from {{g4862}} and {{g5463}}; to sympathize in gladness, congratulate

g4797.definition: [συγχέω]   or συγχύνωfrom {{g4862}} and χέω (to pour) or its alternate; to commingle promiscuously, i.e. (figuratively) to throw (an assembly) into disorder, to perplex (the mind)

g4798.definition: [συγχράομαι] from {{g4862}} and {{g5530}}; to use jointly, i.e. (by implication) to hold intercourse in common

g4800.definition: [συζάω] from {{g4862}} and {{g2198}}; to continue to live in common with, i.e. co-survive (literally or figuratively)
